channel.title: Super hard Combat Levels + Npc Auto attack
channel.description: Now i thought this would be simple too I did.... I was wrong. Here is what I am using: Deltascape (cleaned by me) Now I want certain npcs to attack people below certain combat levels So i look at the slayer codes for slayer tasks Im thinking oh thats simple So off I go thinking its going to be easy Type some code [code]case 73: if (combatLevel <= 20) { return true; } break;[/code] Put that in the npc gets annoyed thing (its not in the wrong place in that code So i get some errors about the break So i take it away Now its trying to tell me that age old error about how ints cannot be used for if (combatLevel) etc But im going that cant be right slayer uses it So i go hunting and it turns out in npc handler the npcs have a combat level and thats what the program thought i meant So i went DAMNABIT Now if anyone would be so kind to post a fix for me i would be greatly inclined in ur favour

item.title: Super hard Combat Levels + Npc Auto attack
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

I think i solved it

Read full topic

item.title: Super hard Combat Levels + Npc Auto attack
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

no
I want the npc to attack the player if it is in range without the player attacking it first if the players combat level is lower than the npcs combat level like on runescape

Read full topic
item.source: Super hard Combat Levels + Npc Auto attack

item.title: Super hard Combat Levels + Npc Auto attack
item.dc:creator: @madgamer madgamer
item.description:
@madgamer wrote:

You could always make a boolean that checked to see if the player’s combat level was adequate?

private boolean canAttackNpc(int npcId) { if (combatlevel < 20 && npcId == (some random npc id)) { return false; } return true; }

Read full topic
item.source: Super hard Combat Levels + Npc Auto attack

item.title: Super hard Combat Levels + Npc Auto attack
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

Actually No what i really want is someone to post the code that will let me use the players combat level instead of the npcs combat level so it should make it if (c.combatLevel or something but whatever u said im sure made sense to you

Read full topic
item.source: Super hard Combat Levels + Npc Auto attack

item.title: Super hard Combat Levels + Npc Auto attack
item.dc:creator: @madgamer madgamer
item.description:
@madgamer wrote:

CombatLevel is an multi-dimensional array, so unless you specify which part of it you want used, it can’t be compared against a 1-dimensional integer.

Read full topic

item.title: Super hard Combat Levels + Npc Auto attack
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

Now i thought this would be simple too I did…
I was wrong.
Here is what I am using:
Deltascape (cleaned by me)
Now I want certain npcs to attack people below certain combat levels
So i look at the slayer codes for slayer tasks
Im thinking oh thats simple
So off I go thinking its going to be easy
Type some code

case 73: if (combatLevel <= 20) { return true; } break;
Put that in the npc gets annoyed thing (its not in the wrong place in that code
So i get some errors about the break
So i take it away
Now its trying to tell me that age old error about how ints cannot be used for if (combatLevel) etc
But im going that cant be right slayer uses it
So i go hunting and it turns out in npc handler the npcs have a combat level and thats what the program thought i meant
So i went DAMNABIT
Now if anyone would be so kind to post a fix for me i would be greatly inclined in ur favour

Read full topic
item.source: Super hard Combat Levels + Npc Auto attack
